name: WatchKeeper International
description:
WatchKeeper is redefining incident monitoring and response, giving security managers the most comprehensive  global view of  risks facing their organisation.
​
The platform connects internal real-estate, HR, travel bookings, access control, CCTV and other network-connected systems, giving security managers and crisis responders complete domain awareness of their assets and personnel globally. 
 
Live mapping of third party risk layers, such as social media, political risk analysis and natural disaster feeds, can generate real-time alerts, notifying security managers of incidents that could threaten the safety of employees or impact business operations.  
 
Dashboard metrics give instantaneous key metrics on facilities and employees in the impacted area, and integration with mass notification systems ensures rapid staff accounting and efficient business continuity. 
 
WatchKeeper is redefining how corporate security managers identify and manage risks to their organisations.

jobs.title: Junior UI Designer
jobs.description:
About the company

WatchKeeper International is a London-based security technology company, developing geospatial software to help the biggest organisations in the world monitor and respond to adverse events such as natural disasters, terrorism and civil unrest.

About the role

WatchKeeper is looking for a freelance Junior UI Designer to join our product team in our London office and help us build a brand new platform. If you genuinely love what you do and want to build something you are proud of, we’d like to meet you.

What you'll be doing

- Building high-fidelity prototypes and working closely with developers as components are built into the application.
- Translating design concept artwork and UX flows into interactive flows
- Graphic design for icons, map markers and other assets
- Working in a fast paced, friendly environment in a talented team
- Testing that UI flows are intuitive through testing with users

This is a great opportunity to work directly alongside the CEO and CTO, being exposed to all facets of the business growth process. You will work as part of a talented product team using the latest tech and lean software development methodologies.

Must have

- A portfolio of design work (personal or commercial projects)
- Experienced using interactive prototyping tools such as figma/axure/invision
- Experience designing UI for web and mobile
- Good communicator
- Clean visual design sense
- Love to solve problems and take ownership

Nice to have

- Basic frontend coding knowledge HTML/CSS/JS
- Experience working in a startup environment
- UX knowledge

What you will get from us

- Plenty of responsibility and different challenges every day
- Chance to shape a new product and be involved in all aspects of the development lifecycle
- Work closely with the co-founders (CEO and CTO)
- Hands-on involvement in growing a start-up and the opportunity to work at the grass-roots of building a business
- Excellent opportunity
- Great location at a beautiful office in the heart of Clerkenwell, London

Benefits

- Work from home opportunities
- Casual dress
- Company events & social hours
